alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 10:26PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Boundary and west central Bonner Counties through 1000 PM PDT... At 925 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Ponderay, or 12 miles northwest of Sandpoint, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ponderay, Schweitzer Mountain, Coolin, and Colburn. This includes U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 479 and 487. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
